stories.text:
I've tried to learn programming through many MOOCs but failed multiple times.

Are there any good resources that are interesting to learn? The problem I face is most of these MOOCs are too boring in the beginning and I usually end up abandoning them.

Lately, I came across Project Euler and I'm having fun solving the challenges on the platform. I'm planning to learn Python as I like to pivot my career towards the data side and may create some generative art in the future!

Some help would be appreciated!

To give some context, I work as a Product Engineer developing digital solutions for an energy company. I don't code, but I understand the whole software development process at a high level. I currently act as a bridge between the development team and the management.

My expertise in programming is limited to the following: - I've fairly a good grasp of HTML, something I learned by editing websites. - I know a bit of SQL to query data - I have some experience in Arduino programming and know how to code basic stuff - I learnt C while in college and understand the basics of loops, conditional statements, etc.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to learn Programming in an interesting way?
